name: Cinnamon
climate: Cinnamon trees thrive best in tropical climates with high humidity.
They require temperatures between 20째C (68째F) to 30째C (86째F) to grow well.
Heavy rainfall ranging from 1,500mm to 2,500mm annually is ideal.
They do not tolerate frost or extremely cold temperatures, which can damage them.
sunlight: Cinnamon trees prefer full sunlight for most of the day to flourish.
They are adaptable and can tolerate partial shade, especially in hot climates.
Direct sunlight for extended periods is beneficial for cinnamon growth.
However, in very hot areas, some afternoon shade may prevent leaf scorching.
watering: Regular watering is important to keep the soil consistently moist but not soggy.
During the growing season, ensure that the soil does not dry out completely.
In less humid environments, increasing the frequency of watering may be necessary.
Inadequate watering can lead to poor growth and reduced foliage vigor.
soil: Cinnamon trees require well-drained sandy or loamy soil for optimal growth.
Soil pH should be slightly acidic to neutral, around 5.5 to 6.5 for best results.
Rich, fertile soils with good organic matter content enhance growth and health.
Compacted or waterlogged soils can lead to root rot and other growth issues.
extra_care_tip: Prune cinnamon trees regularly to shape them and remove dead or weak branches.
Protect young trees from strong winds, which can damage or uproot them.
